intro: Leptogonum domingense var. molle, commonly known as the soft-leaved leptogonum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Dominica. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
